summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from June-July 2019 among FBI and possibly other law enforcement personnel coordinating a conference call to discuss victim interviews in the Jeffrey Epstein case. The emails show logistical planning for the call, with one participant noting they are in the hospital and another referencing a meeting at the SDNY (Southern District of New York).

events.title: Scheduled conference call on Epstein victim interviews
events.description: A conference call was scheduled for 2:00 PM Eastern Time to discuss victim interviews in the Epstein case among FBI personnel and possibly others.

events.title: Hospitalization of a participant
events.description: One participant in the email chain indicates they are in the hospital and would only be able to call in to the scheduled meeting.

events.title: SDNY meeting reference
events.description: An email mentions a 2:00 meeting on Monday at SDNY (Southern District of New York), suggesting coordination with federal prosecutors.

keyFacts: FBI personnel were actively coordinating in June-July 2019 to discuss victim interviews in the Epstein case.
The correspondence indicates involvement of the FBI's NY Criminal Division Violent Crimes and Victim Services Division, specifically the Child Victim Services Unit.
One participant was in the hospital but attempted to participate in the call, showing the ongoing priority of the case.
The emails reference a meeting at the SDNY, indicating coordination between FBI investigators and federal prosecutors.
The document shows the use of unclassified conference calls for case discussions among law enforcement.
